posts.name: Layton
posts.cooked:
discoduck39/updatedcode8564 (github.com)

my GitHub is above whenever I try to look at the other autos in Smart dashboard it pops up blank and it won’t even let me run a auto any help I would be grateful for

posts.name: Andy Gasser
posts.cooked:
Your method that is using reflection to populate the chooser is not correct.

All of the methods on Auto take two parameters, so none of them match method.getParameterCount() == 1

You’ll need to pass both parameters when you invoke the method.

posts.name: Tim Winters
posts.cooked:
Forget fixing your reflection, you shouldn’t be using it at all.

This is your code. You have access to the methods you need.

etc

You’ll need to fix your RobotContainer#getAutonomousCommand to use the selector

posts.name: Layton
posts.cooked: What would I need to fix about it

posts.name: Tim Winters
posts.cooked: About which part? The getAutonomousCommand method? It returns a hardcoded command

posts.name: Layton
posts.cooked: Yes the get auto command I don’t fully understand what’s wrong with it the way it is right now. Also why shouldn’t I be using the code given above? I have been told this is a good way of doing it.

posts.name: Tim Winters
posts.cooked:
If you look at the autonomousInit method in Robot.java , it calls

In RobotContainer.java , you’ve defined getAutonomousCommand as

Notice that this doesn’t use the auto selector that you’re trying to use. It returns a command that does nothing at the moment. You’ll want to fix this method to use the selector.

As for why you shouldn’t be using reflection, the main reason is that it’s necessary. I explained above how you could get the commands without reflection. I’m not sure who told you it was a good idea, but they were wrong. Especially in this case where the better solution is much simpler
